explanations.machine learning: The paper explicitly mentions building a credit scoring prediction model using machine learning classifiers.
explanations.supervised learning: The study uses labeled data (German credit data) to train classifiers, which is a characteristic of supervised learning.
explanations.classification: The paper focuses on credit scoring, which is a classification problem (classifying debtors as good or bad credit risks).
explanations.support vector machine: SVM is listed as one of the machine learning classifiers used in the study.
explanations.SVM: Abbreviation for support vector machine, which is used in the study.
explanations.decision tree: Decision Tree (C5.0) is mentioned as one of the machine learning classifiers used.
explanations.feature learning: The paper discusses different feature selection techniques (Information-gain, Gain-Ratio and Chi-Square) to select important input predictors, which relates to feature learning.
